data.title: Failed to build Android package on Debian 64bit
data.body:
I tried building the testcase game for Android, but the launcher said "The build seems to have failed."

Configurations:

```
Full name: Ren'Py Testcase
Short name: Ren'Py Test
Pkg name: renpy-test
App version: 1.0
Version code: 100
Landscape mode
Expantion APK: No
Internet: No
```

Next, I tried "apache-ant/bin/ant clean release" on apt-6.16.0 directory.

The followng is output of the above command.

```
Buildfile: /home/koichi/developments/renpy/renpy-devel/rapt-6.16.0/build.xml

-check-env:
 [checkenv] Android SDK Tools Revision 20
 [checkenv] Installed at /home/koichi/developments/renpy/renpy-devel/rapt-6.16.0/android-sdk

-setup:
     [echo] Project Name: RenPyTestcase-1.0
  [gettype] Project Type: Application
     [echo] Switching between debug and non debug build: Deleting previous compilation output...
```

data.title: fix doc
data.body:
Fixed doc.

Mouse buttons use keysyms of the **_form form**_ 'mouseup_#' or 'mousedown_#',

data.title: Will not start if the path to game.exe isn't representable in the system encoding.
data.body:
Per http://lemmasoft.renai.us/forums/viewtopic.php?f=8&t=23691&start=30#p296699 , Ren'Py will not start if it has a path like:

c:\Users\田中\desktop\newgame\newgame.exe

. As best as I can tell, this only happens if the path can't be represented by the system encoding - so the error would occur with that path if the system encoding is set to English, but not if it's set to Japanese. 

The error seems to be because of http://bugs.python.org/issue2128 , and the issues underlying it - it seems bad enough that Python can't find its standard library.

This doesn't seem to be a major issue with Ren'Py - it's existed for the life of Ren'Py 6.15, and this is the first time someone has encountered it. At this point, I don't see a workaround that doesn't involve porting to python3.

Comments?

data.title: fix typo
data.body: "効果の音音量" -> "効果音の音量"

data.title: Link to renpy.sh doesn't work
data.body: I tried pasting a link to renpy.sh on my ubuntu desktop but it doesn't execute the launcher, preumably it tries to use ~/Desktop as $BASE instead of install directory.

data.title: update translation
data.body: Updated translation.

data.title: Suggestion: tar.xz as linux archive format
data.body:
I think tar.xz will shrink the package size, and almost Linux distros have it and it's used in many projects.

Could you consider to use it instead of bz2 for SDK?

However, tar.xz is slow to compress, so we have to discuss it for building distributions.
It will be future work.

data.title: Please add other characters to vertical testcase
data.body:
Currently, it is "ロロロあああ". It can test position of glyphs, but it doesn't use vertical glyphs.
Could you change it to "「可愛いね〜」と、彼女は言った。"

The five glyphs: "「", "〜", "」", "、", "。" are changed to other ones.

data.title: Translation issue about lancher
data.body:
I translated lancher and set style like below.

```
    translate japanese python:
        LIGHT   = "mikachan.ttf"
        style.l_default.font = LIGHT                                                                                                   
        style.l_button_text.selected_font = LIGHT
        style.l_button_text.selected_bold = True
        style.l_link_text.font = LIGHT                                                                                                 
        style.l_alternate_text.font = LIGHT                                                                                            
        style.l_navigation_button_text.font = LIGHT
        style.l_navigation_text.font = LIGHT                                                                                           
        style.l_navigation_text.bold = True
        style.l_checkbox_text.selected_font = LIGHT                                                                                    
        style.l_nonbox_text.selected_font = LIGHT                                                                                      
        style.hyperlink_text.font = LIGHT                                                                                              
```

But style.l_default.font returns to be "Roboto-Light.ttf" when I open "change theme" even if I set language to japanese.

tl directory: https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/122050682/tl.zip

data.title: Odd, breaking (but low priority) behavior in \n{fast}
data.body:
```
$ nvln = NVLCharacter(None, kind=nvl)
"%%This doesn't break anything!{fast}"
nvln "And neither does this!{fast}"
nvl clear
nvln "\nHell, and neither does this!{fast}"
extend "\n{color=#ADD8E6}Hah, {/color}even I don't break!{fast}"
#extend "\n{color=#ADD8E6}Bugger, {/color}this time around I would break!{fast}"
nvln "This is line 20!\n{fast}"

#I feel like the evil user doing everything he can to break the engine. Apologies!
#Obviously, Line 18 shows a temporary workaround with \n on the next line, but regardless of
#that, the issue is interesting.

```

data.title: Launcher is crashed when Build Updates is checked without any other options
data.body:
Step to reproduce:
1. click "Build Distributions" on the launcher.
2. check "Build Updates" without four options (All, Linux, Mac, Win)
3. click "Build"

Then, the following error will be occured:

```

Ren'Py 6.16.0.0
Ren'Py Launcher 6.16.0.0
```

data.title: Port after_checkout.sh to non-Linux Unixes
data.body:
`after_checkout.sh` has been using `readlink(1)` to get an absolute path (with
no symlinks) to the renpy root directory.  Unfortunately, `readlink -f` is a
GNU extension, and thus unavailable on the BSDs, including OS X.

[There are](http://stackoverflow.com/q/1055671/120999) a number of options for those systems.  While an exec out to
Python seems like overkill (and is, in fact, a bit slow on my system), the
delay is small enough to not be a problem in a one-time script like this.
Additionally, it seemed silly to include a dozen-line shell function just for
this one usage.  Plus, we know for certain the user has Python, because
otherwise they couldn't run Ren'Py. ;)

I included the parens around `print` just to make sure it works with both
Python 2.x and 3.x.  I doubt this matters, but I figured I might as well.

If we stop caring about resolving symlinks, this entire line [can be replaced](http://stackoverflow.com/a/1371283/120999)
with `$PWD##*`.

data.title: Screen scaling on OS X seems to be different
data.body:
For some reason, running at lower than normal resolution on Mac OS X (the report I have is coming from Lion) causes the sprites to go out of place and generally seems to scale differently to other platforms.

Our game is set in config to run at 1280x720.

Actual behaviour (taken from [one of these](http://support.apple.com/kb/sp619)): ![](http://i56.servimg.com/u/f56/18/58/38/21/screen15.jpg)

Expected behaviour (from a Windows PC): ![](http://i.imgur.com/ibLFavi.png)

Actually, the issue may not be with the resolution. The user has given us [a screenshot](http://i56.servimg.com/u/f56/18/58/38/21/screen16.jpg) at 1280x800 resolution which displays the same issue.

A couple of members of our development teams are using Macs and cannot reproduce this issue themselves (including myself).

Any ideas? 

And would this be more appropriate for the forums rather than Github? If so, I apologise.

data.title: default values in screens not being stored when a combination of Show() and "use" is used to display screens
data.body:
When three screens exist, the first uses the Show() action to show the second, and the third screen is included in the second with the use statement, values defined by the default statement in the third screen will be reset continuously.

Test code to reproduce the issue:

``` python
screen screen_1:
    textbutton "show screen 2" action [Show("screen_2"), Hide("screen_1")]

screen screen_2:
    frame:
        use screen_3

screen screen_3:
    default tt = Tooltip(1)
    if tt.value == 1:
        textbutton "Show 2" action tt.Action(2)
    elif tt.value == 2:
        textbutton "Show 1" action tt.Action(1)

label start:
    call screen screen_1
```

expected result:
    after pressing the "show screen 2" button, one button appears saying "Show 2". clicking that button will make that button be replaced by a button saying "Show 1".

actual result:
    clicking the "Show 2" button does nothing

data.title: fix message
data.body: Fix a message text.

data.title: "Donations" button on the home page of renpy.org
data.body:
Since I can't contribute with new code to this project, I just sent a (very) small donation of money. I read on the wiki that I can send a paypal donation to the address pytom at bishoujo.us, however IMHO it would be better if you could add a "Donate" button on your home page to simplify this process; I think that many other users by seeing your request would be happy to send you something in exchange for your hard work.

Thank you very much and best regards
